channel.title: PseudoCode, anyone heard of it?
channel.description:
Well, I just finished learning a bit of ASCII, Binary and all that stuff. And now my teacher thought it would be best to teach us a bit of something thats closest to real programming. It's said that sometime in the far future we would be able to program in PseudoCode, so I got a head start and learned as much as I could in one hour.
I am not a professional so I'm just going to share what I have learned about PseudoCode and hope it may help you or me out a bit.
[code=PseudoCode]IF lights at the intersection went red THEN stop at the intersection ELSE drive through the red light ENDIF[/code] Correct this if I have something wrong, I really am not telling you what PseudoCode is, I just want to learn.
Also, I am not sure if everything I said at the top of this post was true. Go easy on a script kiddie would ya?

item.title: PseudoCode, anyone heard of it?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I tend to use a C/java style syntax when I want to express an algorithm. So i’ll use curly brackets and just use made up methods that describe what function I want to happen.

I really don’t have to will to post an example…

Read full topic

item.title: PseudoCode, anyone heard of it?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:8, topic:390976”]Psuedocode for a RSPS could be something like this:

if(player.canSpec == true) { playerTwo.kill(); }
And then anyone who reads this code can understand it and adapt it to their own server.[/quote]
More likely it would be like this;

IF player can spec Perform Spec. ELSE Do nothing. END IF.

Read full topic

item.title: PseudoCode, anyone heard of it?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:4, topic:390976”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=486925.msg3568650#msg3568650 date=1302870268]

are you trolling?

I hope so.

“Pseudocode is a compact and informal high-level description of a computer programming algorithm that uses the structural conventions of a programming language, but is intended for human reading rather than machine reading.”

http://users.csc.calpoly.edu/~jdalbey/SWE/pdl_std.html
[/quote]

pseudocode can be wrote however you want as long as you understand what is going on. its a way to get you program and logic planned out on paper. u can use it with or without a flowchart. but ya its suppose to help you code better. at least thats what my teacher told us.[/quote]
What about if someone else wanted to read it?

Read full topic
